docs.title: AA Mobile App User Guide
docs.text: Welcome to the Appropriate Adult (AA) Mobile App User Guide. This documentation will help you understand and use the CAS mobile application.

docs.title: What is the AA Mobile App?
docs.text:
The AA Mobile App allows Appropriate Adults to:

  • Receive Case Broadcasts: Get notified of new case assignments
  • Accept/Acknowledge Cases: Respond to case broadcasts in real-time
  • Manage Profile: Update availability, preferences, and contact information
  • View History: See past assignments and case details
  • Earn Badges: Track achievements and milestones

docs.title: 📱 Using the App
docs.text:
• Using the App — Overview, notifications and main features
  • Profile Management — View and edit your profile settings
  • Accept and Confirm Case — Full flow from notification to confirmation
  • Completed Case — Submitting documentation after completing an interview
  • Case Cancellation — All cancellation scenarios
  • Badges & Gamification — View your badges and achievements

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Download the App from App Store (iOS) or Play Store (Android)
  2. Login
  3. Verify with Email OTP (6 digits)
  4. Enable Biometric Login (Recommended)
  5. Start Receiving Cases!

docs.title: ✅ Accept and Confirm Case
docs.text: This guide covers the complete flow from receiving a case broadcast to confirming your assignment.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
When a new case is available, you will go through these stages:

Push Notification → Accept Case → Selection Pool → Selected → Confirm Assignment

docs.title: When You Receive It
docs.text: When a new case is created and you match all eligibility criteria, you will receive a New Case Broadcast push notification.

docs.title: What It Shows
docs.text: Information Description Case ID Unique case reference number Interview Date/Time Scheduled interview time Location Interview location with map Youth Information Basic youth details Special Requirements Any specific requirements Broadcast Indicator None (B1), 🟡 (B2), or 🔴 (B3)

docs.title: Broadcast Type Indicators
docs.text: Indicator Type Meaning No dot B1 (Standard) Primary region, weighted selection with holding period 🟡 Yellow B2 (Secondary) Primary + Secondary region, FCFS 🔴 Red B3 (Staff-only) Urgent case, all regions, FCFS

docs.title: Step 1: Open the Notification
docs.text: Tap the push notification to open the app and view full case details.

docs.title: Step 2: Review Case Details
docs.text:
Check all the information:

  • Interview time and date
  • Location (use the map to check distance)
  • Youth details
  • Any special requirements

docs.title: Step 3: Accept or Decline
docs.text:
• ✅ Accept: Tap Accept if you are available. For B1, you will be added to the selection pool. For B2/B3, first to accept is moved to confirmation immediately.
  • ❌ Decline (no button): There is no Decline button on this broadcast notification. If you cannot support the case, simply close the notification (treated as decline/unavailable) and the case will continue broadcasting to other AAs (no penalty).

Follow along this short video to see how AA receives broadcast notification and accept it

docs.title: What Happens After Accepting
docs.text:
For B1 broadcasts, after you tap Accept:

  • You are added to the Selection Pool
  • The system enters a Holding Period (5 minutes)
  • All AAs who accept during this period are collected
  • After 5 minutes, the system uses weighted selection to choose one AA

docs.title: 🔄 Withdraw Selection Button
docs.text:
While waiting in the Selection Pool:

  • You will see a Withdraw Selection button
  • Tap this button if you change your mind
  • Withdrawing removes you from the selection pool
  • No penalty for withdrawing during holding period

Follow along this short video to see how AA withdraw selection

docs.title: For B2/B3 Broadcasts
docs.text:
• No holding period – First Come First Serve (FCFS)
  • First AA to tap Accept is immediately moved to Confirmation stage
  • No Withdraw Selection button (instant assignment)

docs.title: When You Receive Confirmation Notification
docs.text: If you are selected from the pool (B1) or first to accept (B2/B3), you will receive an Assignment Confirmation Notification.

docs.title: Review Full Case Details
docs.text:
Open the notification and review complete case information:

  • Youth Details – Name, age, and relevant information
  • IO Contact – Name and phone number
  • Location – Full address with interactive map
  • Interview Time – Scheduled date and time
  • Special Requirements – Any specific case requirements

docs.title: ✅ Confirm
docs.text:
• Tap Confirm to accept the assignment
  • The case is now officially assigned to you
  • You will receive an interview reminder 2 hours before

docs.title: ❌ Decline
docs.text:
• Tap Decline to reject the assignment
  • The case will be re-broadcast to other AAs
  • ⚠️ Warning: This results in a Low Priority flag for 14 days

Follow along this short video to see how AA confirm assignment

docs.title: Low Priority Flag
docs.text:
⚠️ Warning about declining at confirmation stage:

If you decline or timeout without response after being selected:

  • You receive a Low Priority flag for 14 days
  • Lower chance of being selected in weighted selection (B1)
  • This ensures commitment to accepted cases

📌 Note: Withdrawing during B1 holding period does NOT result in Low Priority flag.

docs.title: B1 Flow (Standard Broadcast)
docs.text:
1. Receive Push Notification (B1)
   ↓
2. Tap Accept
   ↓
3. Added to Selection Pool
   ↓
4. Wait during Holding Period (5 mins)
   → Can tap "Withdraw Selection" if needed (no penalty)
   ↓
5. System selects one AA (weighted selection)
   ↓
6. If selected → Receive Confirmation Notification
   ↓
7. Confirm within 5 minutes
   ↓
8. Case officially assigned to you!

docs.title: B2/B3 Flow (FCFS)
docs.text:
1. Receive Push Notification (🟡 or 🔴)
   ↓
2. Tap Accept (first to accept wins)
   ↓
3. Immediately receive Confirmation Notification
   ↓
4. Confirm within 5 minutes
   ↓
5. Case officially assigned to you!

docs.title: After Confirmation
docs.text:
Once you confirm the assignment:

  1. Interview Reminder: You will receive a reminder 2 hours before the scheduled interview
  2. View Details: Go to My Assignments to view case details anytime
  3. Contact IO: You can contact the IO directly using the provided phone number

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Didn't receive broadcast notification:

  • Check phone notification settings are enabled
  • Check if you're in Quiet Hours or pause mode
  • Verify your region and timing preferences match

Didn't receive confirmation notification:

  • Check your phone's notification settings
  • Check if you're in Quiet Hours mode
  • You may not have been selected (B1)

docs.title: ❌ Case Cancellation
docs.text: This guide covers all cancellation scenarios and what you need to do in each case.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Case assignments can be cancelled by different parties for various reasons. This guide explains:

  • Types of cancellation
  • How to acknowledge cancellation
  • Onsite cancellation handling
  • How to claim transport allowance
  • Low Priority flag consequences

docs.title: Types of Cancellation
docs.text: Scenario Initiated By Your Action Consequence Case cancelled IO/Call Centre Acknowledge within 30 mins + submit doc None (can claim transport) AA self-cancellation (Cancel Assignment) You Select reason + confirm cancellation Case re-broadcasts (B2/B3); may trigger Staff-only broadcast if last-minute; set to Low Priority 14 days Decline at confirmation You Tap Decline Low Priority 14 days Timeout at confirmation System None (auto) Low Priority 14 days Timeout at broadcast System None (auto) None (case continues)

docs.title: Cancellation by IO/Call Centre
docs.text: When IO or Call Centre Staff cancels your assigned case, you will receive a Cancellation Notification.

docs.title: When Does This Happen?
docs.text:
Case cancellation can occur when:

  • The youth's situation has changed
  • The interview is postponed or rescheduled
  • Other operational reasons

docs.title: Step 1: Receive Cancellation Notification
docs.text:
When your assigned case is cancelled:

  • You receive a push notification on your phone
  • The notification includes cancellation details
  • Tap to open the app

docs.title: Step 2: Acknowledge
docs.text:
Tap Acknowledge to confirm you have received and understood the cancellation notice.

After acknowledging, select Advanced Cancellation to submit documentation if the interview was cancelled before your arrival.

⏰ Important: You must acknowledge within 30 minutes.

Follow along this short video to see how to acknowledge cancellation

docs.title: What Happens After Acknowledging?
docs.text:
• The system logs your acknowledgement timestamp.
  • You are released from the case (including cooldown removal) and can receive new case broadcasts.
  • If the case was cancelled within 60 minutes before the scheduled interview time and you were assigned, you may submit documentation within 24 hours for payment purposes (see the Onsite Cancellation section below).

docs.title: What If You Don't Acknowledge?
docs.text:
If you don't acknowledge within 30 minutes:

  • The system auto-acknowledges the cancellation and the case proceeds to Cancelled status
  • The system logs it as auto-acknowledged in the audit trail
  • The cancelling user (Call Centre Staff/AAYS Manager) is notified that you did not acknowledge within 30 minutes

docs.title: Onsite Cancellation
docs.text: If the case is cancelled after you have already travelled or arrived at the location, you can submit documentation to claim transport allowance.

docs.title: How to Submit Documentation
docs.text:
1. Go to My Assignments -> Tap the specific case
  2. Tap Submit Documentation for the cancelled case
  3. Select Cancellation form submission
  4. Take photos of transport receipts (MRT/bus tickets, taxi, parking, etc.)
  5. Add notes about your travel/expenses
  6. Tap Submit

Follow along this short video to see how to submit cancellation documentation

docs.title: AA Self-Cancellation (Cancel Assignment)
docs.text: If you are assigned to a case but cannot attend, you can cancel your assignment in the app.

docs.title: How to Cancel
docs.text:
1. Go to My Assignments -> Tap the specific case
  2. Tap Cancel Assignment
  3. Input a cancellation reason (required)
  4. Confirm cancellation

Follow along this short video to see how to cancel assignment

docs.title: What Happens After You Cancel
docs.text:
• ⚠️ You will receive a Low Priority flag
  • The case will automatically re-broadcast based on urgency (B2 or B3)
  • You will exit cooldown and become available for new cases

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Check notifications regularly: Don't miss cancellation notices
  • Think before accepting: Only accept cases you can commit to
  • Confirm quickly: Don't let confirmations timeout
  • Keep receipts: Always keep transport receipts until the case is complete
  • Acknowledge promptly: Don't miss the 30-minute window
  • Submit documentation: If eligible under the 60-minute cancellation rule, submit within 24 hours
  • Take clear photos: Ensure all text on receipts is readable
  • Add detailed notes: Explain your travel and expenses clearly

docs.title: ✅ Completed Case
docs.text: This guide covers what to do after completing an interview.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: After successfully attending and completing an interview, you need to submit documentation through the CAS Mobile App.

docs.title: Step 1: Open My Assignments
docs.text:
• Open the CAS Mobile App
  • Tap the menu icon (☰) on the left
  • Select My Assignments

docs.title: Step 2: Select the Completed Case
docs.text: Find and tap on the case you just completed.

docs.title: Step 3: Submit Documentation
docs.text:
• Fill in Times: Enter the required times
  • Arrival Time ≤ Interview Start Time ≤ Interview End Time
  • Take Photo: Tap Take Photo to capture documentation
  • The app will automatically crop and scan the document
  • You can also tap Upload Photo to select from gallery
  • Review: Check the photo quality is clear and legible
  • Add Notes: Include any relevant notes about the interview
  • Submit: Tap Submit to complete
  • Feedback: Give feedback answer by a 5-star rating about your experience

Follow along this short video to see how to submit documentation

docs.title: Documentation Reminders
docs.text:
If you forget to submit documentation:

  • ⏰ Reminders are sent every 4 hours after the interview
  • Reminders continue until documentation is submitted
  • Tap the reminder notification to go directly to the case

docs.title: View Completed Cases
docs.text:
To view your past completed cases:

  1. Open the left-hand side menu
  2. Tap My History
  3. Browse your completed cases

docs.title: What You Can See
docs.text:
Information Available Case ID ✅ Yes Date ✅ Yes Location ✅ Yes Status ✅ Yes Youth Details and IO information 🔒 Masked

🔒 Note: Youth details are masked in historical cases for privacy protection.

docs.title: Tips for Smooth Completion
docs.text:
• Submit promptly: Complete documentation as soon as possible after the interview
  • Good photos: Ensure photos are clear and all text is readable
  • Detailed notes: Include relevant information in your notes
  • Check status: Verify your submission was successful in My History

docs.title: 🏆 Badges & Gamification (AA Mobile App)
docs.text: This guide explains gamification features such as badges and achievements earning.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Gamification is a value-add feature designed to encourage AA engagement and recognise contributions.

docs.title: Step 1: Open the app and go to Badges & Achievements
Step 2: Review your personal achievements:
docs.text:
• Personal statistics (e.g., cases completed, response rate)
  • Badges earned
  • Next milestone (progress to the next badge)

docs.title: Profile Management (AA Mobile App)
docs.text: This guide explains what AAs can manage in their profile on the CAS Mobile App.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
AA profile data is primarily managed in Salesforce VPRMS and synced to CAS.

In the mobile app, AAs can typically edit:

  • Phone number: 8 digits starting with 6/8/9
  • Notification preferences: Scheduled Availability is checked against the current time when a case is created/broadcast. If it’s outside your configured time range for that day, you will be excluded from broadcasting (you won’t receive the case broadcast push).
  • Regional preferences: primary/secondary regions
  • Timing preferences: checked against the interview date/time (interview time slot). Set this correctly to be included in the eligible AA pool.

All other fields are view-only in the app, including:

  • Email
  • Name
  • AA ID
  • Qualifications
  • Language
  • Race

docs.title: Step 1: Open Profile
docs.text:
Open the app and go to Profile.

→

docs.title: Step 2: Review Your Details
docs.text: You can view your profile information (including view-only fields like Name, Email, AA ID, Qualifications, Language, Race).

docs.title: Step 3: Update Editable Fields
docs.text:
You can typically edit: Phone number, regional preferences, timing preferences

  • Phone number (8 digits starting with 6/8/9)
  • Regional preferences (primary/secondary regions)
  • Timing preferences

docs.title: Step 4: Save Changes
docs.text: Tap Save Details to apply changes. Updates will sync back to VPRMS.

docs.title: Step 1: Go to Notification Preferences
docs.text:
Open the app and go to Profile → Notification Preferences.

→

docs.title: Step 2: Update Preferences
docs.text:
Update your notification settings:

  • Scheduled Availability: set your available time range by day (From/To + day of week). The system checks the current time when the case is created/broadcast. If it’s outside your configured time range for that day, you will be excluded from broadcasting.
  • Date Range Mute: toggle enable to set leave period (From Date/To Date). During this period, you will be excluded from broadcasting.

Example:

  • You set Monday availability: 8:00 AM – 10:00 AM
  • A case is created/broadcast on Monday, 11:00 AM
  • ✅ Result: You will be excluded from broadcasting for that case due to your scheduled availability setup

Note: Interview reminders are always sent regardless of pause settings.

docs.title: Step 3: Save Changes
docs.text: Tap Save Preferences to apply changes.

docs.title: 🎥 Video Tutorial
docs.text: Watch the video tutorial below for a step-by-step guide on managing your profile:

docs.title: 📱 Using the App
docs.text: A quick summary of the CAS Mobile App features.

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
Before using the CAS Mobile App, you need to complete these steps:

  1. Create account on VPRMS – Your AA profile must be created in Salesforce VPRMS by Care Corner staff
  2. Receive setup email – You will receive an email to set up your password
  3. Wait for sync – Your account will be automatically synced from VPRMS to CAS
  4. Login to CAS Mobile App – Use your registered email to login

📌 Note: If you cannot login, contact Care Corner to verify your VPRMS account status.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The CAS Mobile App allows Appropriate Adults to receive case notifications, respond to assignments, and submit documentation after interviews.

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text: Scenario Guide ✅ Accept and Confirm Case Full flow from notification to confirmation ❌ Case Cancellation All cancellation scenarios including onsite cancellation ✅ Completed Case After completing an interview

docs.title: 📢 New Case Broadcast
docs.text:
When: When a new case is created and you are eligible based on matching criteria.

What it shows:

  • Case details
  • Broadcast type indicator (B1 (none)/B2🟡/B3🔴)

Action required: Accept if available, or close to decline.

docs.title: ✅ Assignment Confirmation
docs.text:
When: After you accept a case and are selected by the system.

What it shows:

  • Complete case details
  • Youth information
  • IO contact details
  • Full location with map

Action required: Confirm within 5 minutes or the case is re-broadcast.

⚠️ Declining or timeout without response results in Low Priority flag for 14 days.

docs.title: ❌ Case Cancellation
docs.text:
When: IO or Call Centre cancels your assigned case.

What it shows:

  • Case ID
  • Cancellation details
  • Option to submit documentation

Action required: Acknowledge within 30 minutes. Submit documentation if you've incurred travel expenses.

docs.title: ⏰ Interview Reminder
docs.text:
When: 2 hours before your scheduled interview.

What it shows:

  • Interview time and location
  • Case details

Action required: Prepare for the interview.

📌 Note: Interview reminders are always sent even if you have "Pause Notifications" enabled.

docs.title: 📄 Documentation Reminder
docs.text:
When: After interview is completed, if documentation not yet submitted.

What it shows:

  • Case ID
  • Reminder to submit documentation

Frequency: Sent every 4 hours

Duration: Up to 24 hours (maximum 5 reminders)

Escalation: After 24 hours, AAYS Manager notified

Action required: Go to My Assignments and submit documentation.

docs.title: 🏆 Badge Achievement
docs.text:
When: You earn a badge for your contributions.

What it shows:

  • Badge name and details
  • Congratulations message

docs.title: When Will You Receive Case Broadcast?
docs.text:
When a case is created, the system checks if you qualify based on 8 criteria. You must pass all stages to receive the notification:

  1. Qualifications – Match case requirements (e.g., House Visit, YS Under 10)
  2. Region – Your preferred region matches case location
  3. Timing – Your timing preference matches interview time slot
  4. Gender – Matches case requirement (if specified)
  5. Language – You speak required language (if specified)
  6. Race – Matches case requirement (if specified)
  7. Cooldown – No active case or case within 3 hours
  8. Quiet Hours – Not in pause/quiet hours mode

docs.title: Broadcast Types (B1, B2, B3)
docs.text: Indicator Broadcast Type Meaning No dot B1 (Standard) Primary region, weighted selection 🟡 Yellow B2 (Secondary) Primary + Secondary region, FCFS 🔴 Red B3 (Staff-only) Urgent, all regions, FCFS

docs.title: B1: Standard Broadcast (No indicator)
docs.text:
This is the first broadcast for a new case. Only AAs with primary region matching the case location will receive this notification.

How it works:

  • Holding Period (5 mins): System collects all responses, then uses weighted selection
  • Waiting Period (10 mins): FCFS (first to accept wins)

docs.title: 🟡 B2: Secondary Region Broadcast (Yellow dot)
docs.text:
Sent when B1 fails (no one responded/confirmed) or for non-urgent case re-broadcasts. AAs with primary OR secondary region matching case location will receive this.

How it works:

  • No holding period – FCFS immediately
  • First to accept is moved to confirmation

docs.title: 🔴 B3: Staff-Only Broadcast (Red dot)
docs.text:
Sent for urgent cases (interview ≤ 4 hours away) after B2 fails, or for last minute cases. Only AA Staff receive this notification, ignoring all region/timing preferences.

How it works:

  • No holding period – FCFS immediately
  • AAYS Manager also notified via email/SMS

docs.title: View Available Assignments (Broadcasting)
docs.text: When a case is broadcasting, open the app to view the available assignment and check case details (Case ID, interview time/location, and requirements).

docs.title: View My Assignments
docs.text:
1. Open the left-hand side menu (☰)
  2. Tap My Assignments to view your current assignments
→

docs.title: View My History
docs.text:
1. Open the left-hand side menu (☰)
  2. Tap My History to view your past cases
→

docs.title: What is it?
docs.text:
A Low Priority flag may be applied when:

  • You decline at the confirmation stage (after being selected) or timeout without response at the confirmation stage
  • You self-cancel an assignment

docs.title: Duration
docs.text: 14 days from the decline action.

docs.title: Impact
docs.text:
• Lower chance of being selected during B1 weighted selection
  • Does not affect B2/B3 broadcasts (FCFS)
  • Does not prevent you from receiving broadcasts

docs.title: How to Avoid
docs.text:
• Only accept cases you can truly attend
  • Check your calendar before accepting
  • Consider travel time and location
  • Confirm promptly when selected

docs.title: Not receiving notifications?
docs.text:
• Phone notifications: Settings → Apps → CAS App → Enable notifications
  • App permissions: Allow notifications in app permissions
  • Do Not Disturb: Ensure phone is not in DND mode

docs.title: Not receiving case broadcasts?
docs.text:
• Quiet Hours / Scheduled Availability: Are you outside your configured time range for today?
  • Date Pause: Are you within your muted date range?
  • Cooldown: Do you have an active case or recent case within 3 hours?
  • Profile settings: Are your region and timing preferences correct?
